div.p: Most illustrious man, I have long awaited a messenger to bring this packet to you; finally, one has come very opportunely. I received your letter dated October 23rd. Regarding the council, I still have nothing noteworthy; they are currently dealing with transubstantiation. But soon I will have something and will write immediately. When you have read the copy of my letter to the masked fathers, give it to my nephews, who will transcribe it.
If the translation of Mr. Francesco Negro is pleasing, send it to Oporinus. Farewell and greetings to your entire family, school, and church.
In Chur, on the Nones of November 1551.
